oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mr. Hughes from Nashville... Old Pictures of Any Kind Copied
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Advertisement for new photographs to be taken and old photographs to be copied, regardless of size.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Photographs; Advertisements
Broadsides; Photographs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement for Hughes Brothers, Photographic Artists, appears on pages 113-114 of the 1857 Nashville City Directory. The brothers' names were F. N. Hughes and C. C. Hughes.
